Content:
I started with a massive AC unit and quickly abandoned the idea for dehumidifier units
I did shut down my personal sha units last summer because of heat costs, but that more due to my being too lazy to fix one of the exhaust fans than anything else
The real key is getting hot,stale air __out__, even if it's replaced with only slightly cooler fresh air, it will make a massive difference to get all the "used" air out ASAP

Author: phm87#7395
Content:
for testpools, I run a virtualBox with a VM with ubuntu where I install yiimp. You can split yiimp on several servers/VM for a production pool (more secure and best performances) but for a testpool, you can run everything on 1 VM. Yiimp is composed of several components:
- webpages that can be used for the front-end (you can use apache, nginx or whatever web server)
- the same webpages that must be used for back-end (some scripts are launched inside screens) to perform payments and trading is enabled
- a MySQL database
- coin daemons running and synced
All the above is pretty much standard and the only component that require chosen dependancies is the stratum. Yiimp stratum require a dozen of packages on ubuntu and I think that finding these things in debian can be done.

Author: phm87#7395
Content:
Here is the dozen of lines of packages required to install stratum on ubuntu:
```Stratums:

sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install gcc
sudo apt-get install libgmp3-dev
sudo apt-get install --reinstall build-essential
sudo apt-get install libmysqlclient-dev
sudo apt-get install pkgconf
sudo apt-get install libldap2-dev
sudo apt-get install libidn11-dev
sudo apt-get install librtmp-dev
sudo apt-get install libssl-dev
sudo apt-get install libkrb5-dev

sudo apt-get install libcurl-dev

sudo apt-get install libcurl4-openssl-dev

git clone https://github.com/tpruvot/yiimp
cd yiimp/stratum/iniparser
make
cd ..
make```
